trans-unit.source: Analyze CDN usage patterns
trans-unit.target: Analyze CDN usage patterns

trans-unit.source: You can view usage patterns for your CDN using the following reports: Bandwidth, Data Transferred, Hits, Cache Statuses, Cache Hit Ratio, IPV4/IPV6 Data Transferred.
trans-unit.target: You can view usage patterns for your CDN using the following reports: Bandwidth, Data Transferred, Hits, Cache Statuses, Cache Hit Ratio, IPV4/IPV6 Data Transferred.

trans-unit.source: You can view usage patterns for your CDN using the following reports:
trans-unit.target: You can view usage patterns for your CDN using the following reports:

trans-unit.source: Bandwidth
trans-unit.target: Bandwidth

trans-unit.source: Data Transferred
trans-unit.target: Data Transferred

trans-unit.source: Hits
trans-unit.target: Hits

trans-unit.source: Cache Statuses
trans-unit.target: Cache Statuses

trans-unit.source: Cache Hit Ratio
trans-unit.target: Cache Hit Ratio

trans-unit.source: IPV4/IPV6 Data Transferred
trans-unit.target: IPV4/IPV6 Data Transferred

trans-unit.source: The bandwidth report consists of a graph and data table indicating the bandwidth usage for HTTP and HTTPS over a particular time period.
trans-unit.target: The bandwidth report consists of a graph and data table indicating the bandwidth usage for HTTP and HTTPS over a particular time period.

trans-unit.source: You can view the bandwidth usage across all CDN POPs or a particular POP.
trans-unit.target: You can view the bandwidth usage across all CDN POPs or a particular POP.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to view the traffic spikes and distribution across CDN POPs in Mbps.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to view the traffic spikes and distribution across CDN POPs in Mbps.

trans-unit.source: Select All Edge Nodes to see traffic from all nodes or choose a specific region/node from the dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: Select All Edge Nodes to see traffic from all nodes or choose a specific region/node from the dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go".
trans-unit.target: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go".

trans-unit.source: The report is updated every 5 minute.
trans-unit.target: The report is updated every 5 minute.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Bandwidth report</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Bandwidth report</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This report consists of a graph and data table indicating the traffic usage for HTTP and HTTPS over a particular time period.
trans-unit.target: This report consists of a graph and data table indicating the traffic usage for HTTP and HTTPS over a particular time period.

trans-unit.source: You can view the traffic usage across all CDN POPs or a particular POP.
trans-unit.target: You can view the traffic usage across all CDN POPs or a particular POP.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to view the traffic spikes and distribution across CDN POPs in GB.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to view the traffic spikes and distribution across CDN POPs in GB.

trans-unit.source: Select All Edge Nodes to see traffic from all notes or choose a specific region/node from the dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: Select All Edge Nodes to see traffic from all notes or choose a specific region/node from the dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go" .
trans-unit.target: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go" .

trans-unit.source: The report is updated every 5 minute.
trans-unit.target: The report is updated every 5 minute.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data transferred report</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data transferred report</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This report describes the distribution of request status codes for your content.
trans-unit.target: This report describes the distribution of request status codes for your content.

trans-unit.source: Every request for content will generate an HTTP status code.
trans-unit.target: Every request for content will generate an HTTP status code.

trans-unit.source: The status code describes how edge POPs handled the request.
trans-unit.target: The status code describes how edge POPs handled the request.

trans-unit.source: For example, 2xx status codes indicate that the request was successfully served to a client, while a 4xx status code indicates an error occurred.
trans-unit.target: For example, 2xx status codes indicate that the request was successfully served to a client, while a 4xx status code indicates an error occurred.

trans-unit.source: For more details about HTTP status code, see [status codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ListofHTTPstatuscodes).
trans-unit.target: For more details about HTTP status code, see [status codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ListofHTTPstatuscodes).

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet located next to "go".
trans-unit.target: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet located next to "go".

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hits report</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hits report</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This report describes the distribution of cache hits and cache misses for client request.
trans-unit.target: This report describes the distribution of cache hits and cache misses for client request.

trans-unit.source: Since the fastest performance comes from cache hits, you can optimize data delivery speeds by minimizing cache misses and expired cache hits.
trans-unit.target: Since the fastest performance comes from cache hits, you can optimize data delivery speeds by minimizing cache misses and expired cache hits.

trans-unit.source: Cache misses can be reduced by configuring your origin server to avoid assigning "no-cache" response headers, by avoiding query-string caching except where strictly needed, and by avoiding non-cacheable response codes.
trans-unit.target: Cache misses can be reduced by configuring your origin server to avoid assigning "no-cache" response headers, by avoiding query-string caching except where strictly needed, and by avoiding non-cacheable response codes.

trans-unit.source: Expired cache hits can be avoided by making an asset's max-age as long as possible to minimize the number of requests to the origin server.
trans-unit.target: Expired cache hits can be avoided by making an asset's max-age as long as possible to minimize the number of requests to the origin server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cache statuses report</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cache statuses report</linkText>

trans-unit.source: TCP_HIT: Served from Edge.
trans-unit.target: TCP_HIT: Served from Edge.

trans-unit.source: The object was in cache and had not exceeded its max-age.
trans-unit.target: The object was in cache and had not exceeded its max-age.

trans-unit.source: TCP_MISS: Served from Origin.
trans-unit.target: TCP_MISS: Served from Origin.

trans-unit.source: The object was not in cache and the response was back to origin.
trans-unit.target: The object was not in cache and the response was back to origin.

trans-unit.source: TCP_EXPIRED _MISS: Served from origin after revalidation with origin.
trans-unit.target: TCP_EXPIRED _MISS: Served from origin after revalidation with origin.

trans-unit.source: The object was in cache but had exceeded its max-age.
trans-unit.target: The object was in cache but had exceeded its max-age.

trans-unit.source: A revalidation with origin resulted in the cache object being replaced by a new response from origin.
trans-unit.target: A revalidation with origin resulted in the cache object being replaced by a new response from origin.

trans-unit.source: TCP_EXPIRED _HIT: Served from Edge after revalidation with origin.
trans-unit.target: TCP_EXPIRED _HIT: Served from Edge after revalidation with origin.

trans-unit.source: The object was in cache but had exceeded its max-age.
trans-unit.target: The object was in cache but had exceeded its max-age.

trans-unit.source: A revalidation with the origin server resulted in the cache object being unmodified.
trans-unit.target: A revalidation with the origin server resulted in the cache object being unmodified.

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go".
trans-unit.target: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go".

trans-unit.source: TCP_HIT - This status is reported when a request is served directly from the POP to the client.
trans-unit.target: TCP_HIT - This status is reported when a request is served directly from the POP to the client.

trans-unit.source: An asset is immediately served from a POP when it is cached on the POP closest to the client and it has a valid TTL.
trans-unit.target: An asset is immediately served from a POP when it is cached on the POP closest to the client and it has a valid TTL.

trans-unit.source: TTL is determined by the following response headers:
trans-unit.target: TTL is determined by the following response headers:

trans-unit.source: Cache-Control: s-maxage
trans-unit.target: Cache-Control: s-maxage

trans-unit.source: Cache-Control: max-age
trans-unit.target: Cache-Control: max-age

trans-unit.source: Expires
trans-unit.target: Expires

trans-unit.source: TCP_MISS - This status indicates that a cached version of the requested asset was not found on the POP closest to the client.
trans-unit.target: TCP_MISS - This status indicates that a cached version of the requested asset was not found on the POP closest to the client.

trans-unit.source: The asset will be requested from either an origin server or an origin shield server.
trans-unit.target: The asset will be requested from either an origin server or an origin shield server.

trans-unit.source: If the origin server or the origin shield server returns an asset, it will be served to the client and cached on both the client and the edge server.
trans-unit.target: If the origin server or the origin shield server returns an asset, it will be served to the client and cached on both the client and the edge server.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, a non-200 status code (e.g., 403 Forbidden, 404 Not Found, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, a non-200 status code (e.g., 403 Forbidden, 404 Not Found, etc.)

trans-unit.source: will be returned.
trans-unit.target: will be returned.

trans-unit.source: TCP_EXPIRED _HIT - This status is reported when a request that targeted an asset with an expired time to live (TTL), such as when the asset's max-age has expired, was served directly from the POP to the client.
trans-unit.target: TCP_EXPIRED _HIT - This status is reported when a request that targeted an asset with an expired time to live (TTL), such as when the asset's max-age has expired, was served directly from the POP to the client.

trans-unit.source: An expired request typically results in a revalidation request to the origin server.
trans-unit.target: An expired request typically results in a revalidation request to the origin server.

trans-unit.source: In order for a TCP_EXPIRED _HIT to occur, the origin server must indicate that a newer version of the asset does not exist.
trans-unit.target: In order for a TCP_EXPIRED _HIT to occur, the origin server must indicate that a newer version of the asset does not exist.

trans-unit.source: This type of situation will typically update that asset's Cache-Control and Expires headers.
trans-unit.target: This type of situation will typically update that asset's Cache-Control and Expires headers.

trans-unit.source: TCP_EXPIRED _MISS - This status is reported when a newer version of an expired cached asset is served from the POP to the client.
trans-unit.target: TCP_EXPIRED _MISS - This status is reported when a newer version of an expired cached asset is served from the POP to the client.

trans-unit.source: This occurs when the TTL for a cached asset has expired (e.g., expired max-age) and the origin server returns a newer version of that asset.
trans-unit.target: This occurs when the TTL for a cached asset has expired (e.g., expired max-age) and the origin server returns a newer version of that asset.

trans-unit.source: This new version of the asset will be served to the client instead of the cached version.
trans-unit.target: This new version of the asset will be served to the client instead of the cached version.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, it will be cached on the edge server and the client.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, it will be cached on the edge server and the client.

trans-unit.source: CONFIG_NOCACHE - This status indicates that a customer-specific configuration on our edge POP prevented the asset from being cached.
trans-unit.target: CONFIG_NOCACHE - This status indicates that a customer-specific configuration on our edge POP prevented the asset from being cached.

trans-unit.source: NONE - This status indicates that a cache content freshness check was not performed.
trans-unit.target: NONE - This status indicates that a cache content freshness check was not performed.

trans-unit.source: TCP_ CLIENT_REFRESH _MISS - This status is reported when an HTTP client (e.g., browser) forces an edge POP to retrieve a new version of a stale asset from the origin server.
trans-unit.target: TCP_ CLIENT_REFRESH _MISS - This status is reported when an HTTP client (e.g., browser) forces an edge POP to retrieve a new version of a stale asset from the origin server.

trans-unit.source: By default, our servers prevent an HTTP client from forcing our edge servers to retrieve a new version of the asset from the origin server.
trans-unit.target: By default, our servers prevent an HTTP client from forcing our edge servers to retrieve a new version of the asset from the origin server.

trans-unit.source: TCP_ PARTIAL_HIT - This status is reported when a byte range request results in a hit for a partially cached asset.
trans-unit.target: TCP_ PARTIAL_HIT - This status is reported when a byte range request results in a hit for a partially cached asset.

trans-unit.source: The requested byte range is immediately served from the POP to the client.
trans-unit.target: The requested byte range is immediately served from the POP to the client.

trans-unit.source: UNCACHEABLE - This status is reported when an asset's Cache-Control and Expires headers indicate that it should not be cached on a POP or by the HTTP client.
trans-unit.target: UNCACHEABLE - This status is reported when an asset's Cache-Control and Expires headers indicate that it should not be cached on a POP or by the HTTP client.

trans-unit.source: These types of requests are served from the origin server
trans-unit.target: These types of requests are served from the origin server

trans-unit.source: This report indicates the percentage of cached requests that were served directly from cache The report provides the following details:
trans-unit.target: This report indicates the percentage of cached requests that were served directly from cache The report provides the following details:

trans-unit.source: The requested content was cached on the POP closest to the requester.
trans-unit.target: The requested content was cached on the POP closest to the requester.

trans-unit.source: The request was served directly from the edge of our network.
trans-unit.target: The request was served directly from the edge of our network.

trans-unit.source: The request did not require revalidation with the origin server.
trans-unit.target: The request did not require revalidation with the origin server.

trans-unit.source: The report doesn't include:
trans-unit.target: The report doesn't include:

trans-unit.source: Requests that are denied due to country filtering options.
trans-unit.target: Requests that are denied due to country filtering options.

trans-unit.source: Requests for assets whose headers indicate that they should not be cached.
trans-unit.target: Requests for assets whose headers indicate that they should not be cached.

trans-unit.source: For example, Cache-Control: private, Cache-Control: no-cache, or Pragma: no-cache headers will prevent an asset from being cached.
trans-unit.target: For example, Cache-Control: private, Cache-Control: no-cache, or Pragma: no-cache headers will prevent an asset from being cached.

trans-unit.source: Byte range requests for partially cached content.
trans-unit.target: Byte range requests for partially cached content.

trans-unit.source: The formula is: (TCP_ HIT/(TCP_ HIT+TCP_MISS))*100
trans-unit.target: The formula is: (TCP_ HIT/(TCP_ HIT+TCP_MISS))*100

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates, then click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go" .
trans-unit.target: You can export and download the data by clicking the excel sheet icon located next to "go" .

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cache hit ratio report</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cache hit ratio report</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This report shows the traffic usage distribution in IPV4 vs IPV6.
trans-unit.target: This report shows the traffic usage distribution in IPV4 vs IPV6.

trans-unit.source: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates.
trans-unit.target: Select Date range to view data for today/this week/this month, etc. or enter custom dates.

trans-unit.source: Then, click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.
trans-unit.target: Then, click "go" to make sure your selection is updated.

trans-unit.source: Reports can only be generated within the last 18 months.
trans-unit.target: Reports can only be generated within the last 18 months.
